entry.title: May a Thousand Blossoms Bloom
entry.summary:
Author: ovenbaked_seasalt_cracker

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,229Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 3

Summary: Being a flower nymph who stays in the wooded meadow you were born, it isn't everyday you come face-to-face with a man, much less one that crash lands in your forest...-Banned from Gotham, Jason the God of Destruction wakes up in a Lonely Forest far from civilization and stripped of his godly powers. He soon finds himself welcomed into a world filled with Nymphs, and mythical creatures. Will he find a budding love? How will he get his godhood back? All he knows is that there is a semi-naked woman watching his every move as he nurses himself back to health in this meadow.-The first chapter/prologue is mainly setting up the world and Jason's exile. Reader involvement doesn't happen until chapter 2.Disclaimer!! The reader is written with the intention of being POC and chubby/not straight sizeContent warnings will be at the start of chapters!

entry.title: Cut and Run
entry.summary:
Author: Bubbling24

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,509Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 111

Summary: In a city like Gotham, information is currency. And you've made a career out of getting people to talk.Not by force. Not with threats. Just a salon chair, a mirror, and the kind of silence that makes people fill it with secrets. Affairs. Deals. Who’s moving into which block. Who’s gone missing. Who’s about to.You’re not a vigilante. You don’t wear a mask. You just know when something’s about to crack - and lately, Gotham’s been humming like a live wire.And you weren’t supposed to matter. Not to anyone.And especially not to the man who just blew up a bar because you said it gave you a bad feeling.

entry.title: Good Luck, Babe.
entry.summary:
Author: teklarn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,570Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Born as the heir to a dirty fortune and nothing more, since you could walk you’ve known you’d marry someone for the sake of carrying on your family’s legacy. Trying to find love was never forbidden―it was simply out of the question. There was no point in finding it when you were betrothed to a complete stranger. As the prized and only daughter of Roman Sionis, otherwise known as the infamous crime lord Black Mask, what choice was there to make?Mafia boss Bruce Wayne strikes a deal with your father―join your two incredibly powerful and wealthy families by marrying off the soul heirs. That would be you, and Bruce Wayne’s adopted ‘golden son,’ Richard Grayson.The first time you meet Dick, he’s nothing short of a typical rich kid. Polite in all the ways that mattered, a little arrogant and a little flashy for your taste, but cute nonetheless. But when you meet Dick’s bodyguard, Jason Todd―a reformed criminal paying off his debt to the Wayne’s―everything changes. Jason is handsome, aloof, dangerous, everything you aren’t allowed to have.And now, he’s suddenly everything you want.

entry.title: red is what lies between us
entry.summary:
Author: ActuallyNonsense

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,119Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: You chase ghosts through a city that devours its own, still clinging to the idea that truth matters if you frame it right. Jason Todd doesn’t believe in truth, only aftermaths — blood-slick floors, unfinished vengeance, consequences that rot beneath the skin. You shouldn’t cross paths, but symmetry is cruel like that: a reckless photojournalist who won’t stop looking, a dead man who can’t stop being seen. You're each other’s contradiction — empathy and ruin, hope and retaliation, the quiet horror of still caring. But Gotham has a habit of shaping its children into funhouse mirrors of each other, and the closer you get to its broken heart, the harder it is to pretend you're just passing through. (Or: You keep photographing ghosts until one looks back.)

entry.title: The House hunger built
entry.summary:
Author: FearTheHime

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,647Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 79

Summary: "Of course I eat people, I mean...It's not something I would broadcast since it's...well Gotham and they began to make a phad about it because the citizens are brilliantly...stupid."Bodies are piling up, whatever is left. Families; different backgrounds, different ethnics, religions, looks are being eaten and whatever is left into a master piece. Some sort of art with the remains and everyone was losing time and leads to find out who has been feasting upon Gotham citizens. Jason however, knew of a Cannibal that he totally never mentioned to Bruce. It's not Jason's fault he died before revealing his darkest discovery and that discovery is in the form of a boy he had left behind. [M/N] [L/N]; Mortitan, brilliant, a chef of his own making and conisear of flesh.All Jason needed to do is sweeten the deal in a way that drives all people, after all at the end of the day {M/N] is human after all."Besides..it's people...they are literally born every day..so who cares if a few of them...just disapear once in a while?"

entry.title: Josie and the Pussycat
entry.summary:
Author: insert_cooler_username

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 70,329Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 762

Summary: “Got your letter,” he grumbles, coming closer, looming over your supine form. A mass of muscle and leather and anger. “Is that what you really want?”“What?” you snap out. “A divorce?” You scoff, shaking your head at him. “No, what I want is a husband that will actually come home and raise his kid like he promised. But instead I have someone who follows us around on rooftops and lurks in the shadows thinking he’s some silent protector and not a fucking deadbeat. So yeah, I’ll settle for a divorce. It’s the next best thing I have.”-Your husband left you before he could fuck things up. Too bad he still is when he appears in your life several years later, on the advent of your move from Gotham, and asks to meet his daughter. The past is a hard pill to swallow, but Josie deserves a dad. You just have to make sure you don't pussy out of seeing Jason again. Or, at least, that you don't kill each other.
